name: Poppa’s Pride
instructions:
1. Add bourbon, ginger juice, lemon wedges and mint to cocktail shaker.
2. Add ice and shake until chilled.
3. Strain into a highball or Collins glass over fresh ice.
4. Top with soda water and Angostura bitters (don't be shy about the bitters).
5. Garnish with a mint sprig.
description: Made with Buck and a Whiskey Smash, this ginger-laced bourbon drink is one of Brooklyn bartender Jay Zimmerman's signature cocktail recipe.

ingredients.name: Bourbon Whiskey
ingredients.description:
A type of American whiskey, primarily made from corn and aged in new charred oak barrels. Bourbon has a sweet and full-bodied flavor profile.

To be labeled as bourbon, a whiskey must meet the following criteria:

1. Grain Mash Composition: Bourbon must be made from a grain mash that is at least 51% corn. The remaining portion of the mash can include other grains such as barley, rye, and wheat.

2. Distillation: Bourbon must be distilled to no more than 160 proof (80% alcohol by volume) and entered into the barrel for aging at no more than 125 proof (62.5% alcohol by volume).

3. Barrel Aging: Bourbon must be aged in new charred oak barrels. There is no minimum aging requirement for bourbon, but to be labeled as "straight bourbon," it must be aged for at least two years.

4. No Additives: Bourbon must not contain any additives except water to adjust the proof.

5. Bottling Strength: Bourbon must be bottled at a minimum of 80 proof (40% alcohol by volume).

6. Geographic Origin: While bourbon can be produced anywhere in the United States, it is strongly associated with Kentucky, and many consider Kentucky bourbon to be a distinctive category.

ingredients.name: Ginger syrup
ingredients.description:
Syrup infused with ginger root.

This ginger syrup is fantastic in cocktails, but it also makes an out-of-this-world ginger ale. To make ginger ale, simply fill an ice-filled glass a third of the way with the syrup, top with soda water and a squeeze of lime, stir and enjoy.

ingredients.name: Lemon
ingredients.description: Lemon is a citrus fruit known for its bright yellow color and tart flavor.

ingredients.name: Mint
ingredients.description: Mint refers to a family of aromatic herbs known for their refreshing flavor and fragrance. The most commonly used and recognized type of mint is spearmint (Mentha spicata), but there are various other species and hybrids, including peppermint (Mentha × piperita).

ingredients.name: Club soda
ingredients.description:
Club soda is a manufactured form of carbonated water, commonly used as a drink mixer. Also known as soda, siphon soda water, soda water, siphon soda, and siphon water.

Soda water is artificially or naturally carbonated water, to which mineral salts have been added. The product without the salts is termed "seltzer" or "seltzer water."

Carbonated water with added minerals—commonly sodium bicarbonate or salt—club soda was designed to approximate mineral water, which is often naturally fizzy, but can carry a hefty price tag. English chemist Joseph Priestly invented the process of carbonation in 1767, when he realized that the carbon dioxide produced during the fermentation of beer could be infused into water. Soon after, Jacob Schweppe, a Swiss watchmaker, figured out how to manufacture carbonated water (which has no added minerals) and club soda. These products would become the cornerstone of the Schweppes Company, which is still in existence today. The added salt or sodium bicarbonate helps to mitigate the sour flavors from the carbonic acid, a byproduct of carbon dioxide.
